p:
Dengue fever, an arbovirus infection predominantly transmitted by vectors of the Aedes aegypti species, is a serious public health issue in Brazil, with seasonal epidemics virtually across the entire national territory. (
1
) The country recorded 572,308 probable cases in 2014; 1,621,797 in 2015; 1,483,623 in 2016; 251,711 in 2017 and 265,934 in 2018. (
2
â€“
4
) All four serotypes of the dengue virus are present in Brazil.
